p:
To check whether electron magnetic noise is among the mechanisms limiting T
m , it is useful to measure T
m at different Gd III ion concentrations as did in Martínez-Pérez et al. ( 2012). These measurements revealed that indeed T
m decreases as Gd III ion concentration increases, which means that electron magnetic noise might be one of the decoherence mechanisms limiting T
m . Nonetheless, it might not be the only one in the light of the two following reasons. First, as mentioned above, the theoretical estimates
T
m
e
do not match the experimental T
m values. Second, T
m does not scale with the Gd III ion concentration x as T
m ∝ 1/ x. This scaling characterizes electron magnetic noise as the only decoherence mechanism limiting T
m and, in this case, establishes that a rise in x of one order of magnitude should divide T
m by 10 (Escalera-Moreno et al., 2019; Lunghi and Sanvito, 2019).
